subject: Travel
title: Persepolis: Palace of Persia
description: One-minute skill: Persepolis: Palace of Persia.

hook.text: The Persian Empire's greatest palace was burned by Alexander the Great in a single drunken night.

buildup.text: Persepolis was built by Darius I around 515 BC. It could host 10,000 guests for ceremonies.

discovery.text: Stone carvings show 23 nations bringing tributes â€” lions, gold, camels, and ivory from across the empire.

twist.text: Alexander supposedly set the fire to avenge Persia's burning of Athens. Some say he did it while drunk.

climax.text: The ruins survived 2,500 years and became Iran's most important cultural site and a symbol of national pride.

punchline.text: A drunken fire destroyed an empire's crown jewel.
